required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: DMT310-003 Topical in the Treatment of Acne Vulgaris
clinical_study.official_title: A Study of Tolerability, Safety, And Efficacy, Of DMT310 In Patients With Acne Vulgaris

brief_summary.textblock: The objective is to evaluate the tolerability, safety, and efficacy of DMT310 topical powder mixed with diluent in male and female patients with moderate to severe facial acne vulgaris.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Efficacy as measured by lesion counts
Efficacy as measured by Investigator Global Assessment (IGA)
primary_outcome.description: 0 None No evidence of facial acne vulgaris Minimal Few noninflammatory lesions (comedones) are present; a few inflammatory lesions(papules/pustules) may be present; no nodulo-cystic lesions are allowed) Mild Several to many noninflammatory lesions (comedones) are present; a few inflammatory lesions (papules/pustules) are present; no nodulo-cystic lesions are allowed Moderate Many noninflammatory (comedones) and inflammatory lesions (papules/pustules) are present; no nodulo-cystic lesions are allowed Severe Significant degree of inflammatory disease; papules/pustules are a predominant feature; a few nodulo-cystic lesions may be present; comedones may be present

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of adverse events as a measure of safety and tolerability
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of adverse events as a measure of safety and tolerability

arm_group.description: DMT310 Powder mixed with Hydrogen Peroxide
Placebo powder mixed with Hydrogen Peroxide

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient is male or non-pregnant female at least 12 years of age.
- Clinical diagnosis of moderate to severe acne vulgaris as determined by:
Investigator's Global Assessment (IGA) at Randomization Patient has at least 20 inflammatory lesions on the face Patient has at least 20 noninflammatory lesions on the face
- Patient is willing to apply the Investigational Product as directed
- Patient is willing and able to comply with the protocol
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient is pregnant or planning to become pregnant
- Patient is taking a topical therapy on the face which may affect the patient's acne
